items.question: From what age can ears be pierced?
items.answer: The Inverness MED system is safe from birth. Infants (0-6 months) require consent and presence of both parents.

items.question: Does piercing hurt?
items.answer: The Inverness system uses fast, simultaneous piercing that minimizes discomfort. Most people describe the feeling as a brief pinch.

items.question: How long does healing take?
items.answer: Earlobes: 6-8 weeks. Cartilage (helix): 3-6 months. You'll receive detailed aftercare instructions after the procedure.

items.question: Are the earrings hypoallergenic?
items.answer: Yes! All Inverness earrings are made from hypoallergenic materials (316L medical steel, titanium, 14K or 24K gold).

items.question: How to prepare for the procedure?
items.answer: Wash your hair and ears before the visit. Don't use makeup or creams near the ears. Eat a meal before the procedure.

items.question: How much does ear piercing cost?
items.answer: One ear: 80 PLN, two ears: 120 PLN (40 PLN discount), helix: 150 PLN. Prices include a pair of medical earrings.

items.question: How to care for freshly pierced ears?
items.answer: Detailed instructions can be found on our aftercare page.

items.question: Do you offer mobile service?
items.answer: Yes! We offer mobile service for an additional fee of 50 PLN. Contact us to schedule an appointment.

aftercare.title: Ear Piercing Aftercare
aftercare.subtitle: Follow these guidelines for optimal healing

sections.title: Hygiene and cleanliness
points: Wash hands before touching earrings
Don't touch earrings unnecessarily
Avoid swimming pools for the first 2 weeks
Protect ears from dirt and dust

sections.title: Sleep and daily care
points: Sleep on clean pillowcase (change every 2-3 days)
Avoid sleeping on freshly pierced ear for 2 weeks
Carefully comb hair, avoiding catching on earrings
Use over-ear headphones instead of earbuds

sections.title: Disinfection
points: Disinfect 2 times daily with solution provided after procedure
Gently rotate earring during disinfection
Don't remove earrings for minimum 6 weeks
Continue disinfection throughout healing period

sections.title: Cosmetics and styling
points: Avoid hair sprays near ears
Don't use perfume on freshly pierced ears
Be careful when removing clothes over head
Avoid hair dyeing for the first 2 weeks

sections.title: What to avoid
points: Don't remove earrings before 6 weeks
Don't use alcohol or hydrogen peroxide for cleaning
Avoid stuffed animals and hats pressing on ears
Don't twist earrings too forcefully

sections.title: Changing earrings
points: Earlobes: you can change after 6 weeks
Cartilage (helix): wait minimum 3 months
First new earrings should be lightweight
Always disinfect new earrings before insertion

sections.title: Further care after healing
points: Clean earrings regularly with warm water and soap
Remove earrings at night if more comfortable
Avoid cheap earrings with nickel
Regularly check earring clasps

sections.title: In case of problems
points: Mild redness in the first days is normal
If severe pain, swelling or discharge appears - contact us
Don't remove earrings during infection without consultation
When in doubt - always call or write
